newsitem.title: GREECE: GOVERNMENT TO SHUT DOWN OVER 30 PLAKA BUSINESSES.
newsitem.headline: GOVERNMENT TO SHUT DOWN OVER 30 PLAKA BUSINESSES.

text.p: The Greek government will shut down over thirty businesses and tear down illegal buildings in the old central Athens district of Plaka in an effort to preserve its character.
Environment Minister Costas Laliotis told a news conference state authorities were determined to apply the law to the letter in order to clear out the popular tourist area of organised crime.
"A climate of terror cannot be allowed to prevail," he said.
Public Order Minister George Romeos and Athens Mayor Dimitris Avramopoulos also attended the news conference.
A 1982 law protecting Plaka, a picturesque area under the Acropolis, was being violated by organised crime that terrorised residents, municipal workers and town planning officials, they said.
These violations were changing the area's appearance and threatening its character, Laliotis said. --Margarita Sotiropoulou, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
